data.title: The 60 Best Movies With Island in the Title
data.meta_description: Over 200 filmgoers have voted on the 60 Best Movies With Island in the Title. Current Top 3: Island in the Sun, Muppet Treasure Island, Mysterious Island ...
data.text:
Ranked By

888 votes

292 voters

Voting Rules

Vote up your favorite movie with island in the name.

Have you ever noticed how many movies there are with island in the name? This list ranks the best movies with island in the title, regardless of genre or rating. What is your favorite movie with island in the name? Leonardo DiCaprio gave a great performance in Shutter Island, a movie with a twist so genius your mind will be blown to pieces when you realize what's going on. There are probably one or two movies with island in the title that you instantly think of, but you might be surprised how many others there are too as you scroll through this list.

This ranked poll of films with island in the title includes movies like Nim's Island, Muppet Treasure Island, and The Island. Don't forget that this list is interactive, meaning you can vote the film names up or down depending on much you liked each movie that has the word island in it.

Most divisive: Island in the Sky

Over 200 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The 60 Best Movies With Island in the Title

Intertwining narratives of love, betrayal, and racial tension unfold in a lush Caribbean setting in this 1957 classic film based on Alec Waugh's provocative novel. The ensemble cast, featuring Harry Belafonte, Joan Fontaine, and Dorothy Dandridge, delivers gripping performances that embody the intricate complexities of societal issues. A true testament to its time, Island in the Sun is a beautifully-woven tapestry of passion and strife.

Released : 1957

Directed by : Robert Rossen

Tim Curry, Kevin Bishop, Billy Connolly

Sailing onto screens in 1996, this delightful family adventure offers a whimsical reimagining of Robert Louis Stevenson's iconic tale with Jim Henson's beloved puppets at the helm. Tim Curry brings his trademark panache to the role of Long John Silver, anchoring the ship with a mixture of charm and menace. Swashbuckling escapades ensue as Kermit, Miss Piggy, and the gang search for hidden treasure, making Muppet Treasure Island a cherished gem in the Muppets' illustrious legacy.

Released : 1996

Directed by : Brian Henson

Also ranks # 119 on Musical Movies With The Best Songs

Also ranks # 24 on The Best Movies Of 1996

Also ranks # 345 on The All-Time Greatest Comedy Films

Michael Craig, Joan Greenwood, Herbert Lom

Inspired by Jules Verne's literary masterpiece, this 1961 sci-fi adventure transports viewers to an uncharted island teeming with fearsome creatures and dazzling natural wonders. The groundbreaking special effects by Ray Harryhausen, including the giant crab and menacing bees, elevate this gripping tale of survival and discovery. A stirring score by Bernard Herrmann underscores the escalating peril faced by the intrepid castaways, ensuring Mysterious Island's status as an enduring cinematic treasure.

Released : 1961

Directed by : Charles De Latour

Ewan McGregor, Scarlett Johansson, Djimon Hounsou

Michael Bay's thought-provoking 2005 sci-fi thriller explores the consequences of humanity's quest for immortality, set within a seemingly utopian society where survivors of a global catastrophe are kept sheltered. Ewan McGregor and Scarlett Johansson deliver compelling performances as they uncover dark secrets while trying to escape their sterile environment. Brimming with stunning visuals and heart-pounding action, The Island challenges the boundaries of morality and control.

Released : 2005

Directed by : Michael Bay

Also ranks # 45 on The 95+ Greatest Dystopian Action Movies

Also ranks # 80 on The Best Futuristic Dystopian Movies Of All Time

Also ranks # 55 on The Best Movies of 2005

Michael Caine, David Warner, Angela Punch McGregor

This 1980 British-American adventure thriller, directed by Michael Ritchie and based on Peter Benchley's novel, tells the story of a journalist investigating the Bermuda Triangle's mysterious disappearances. When he stumbles upon a hidden island inhabited by a group of pirates, he must confront their brutal and deadly ways to survive. Vividly atmospheric and filled with suspense, The Island offers a thrilling voyage into uncharted waters.

Released : 1980

Directed by : Michael Ritchie

Also ranks # 13 on The Best Horror Movies About Deserted Islands

Also ranks # 5 on The Best Desert Island Movies

Also ranks # 77 on The Best Movies by Universal Studios

Wallace Beery, Jackie Cooper, Lionel Barrymore

One of the earliest and most beloved adaptations of Robert Louis Stevenson's celebrated novel, Treasure Island, captivates audiences with its exhilarating tale of pirates, peril, and buried treasure. Starring the accomplished Wallace Beery as Long John Silver and a young Jackie Cooper as Jim Hawkins, the film masterfully transports viewers to an era of high-seas adventures filled with cutthroats and cunning. Treasure Island remains a potent reminder of the enduring allure of the pirate genre in cinematic history.

Released : 1934

Directed by : Victor Fleming
